text:
Hi Community,
Has anyone did this before?
Endgoal: To have when someone changes country on the dropdown option on the right, the flag for that respective country shows up.Currently it does not change to the correct country when you select one <https://blog.leoprinting.co.uk/>

<@UEZJ74UN8> looks like you have this set in your stylesheet to always be this icon:
```
.custom-menu-primary .hs-menu-wrapper > ul > li:last-child > a:before {
    content: url(//cdn2.HubSpot.net/hubfs/4408313/Leoprinting_October2018%20Theme/images/download%20%285%29.png?t=1540472512204);
    margin-right: 4px;
    vertical-align: middle;
}
```
is this using the normal menu module in your system or did you use the `menu()` function to create the menu

from review, looks like you are using the normal menu module. I would recommend in your advanced menus to simply use span tags with classes assigned in the labels to make this function as you need. Ideally, you would want to recreate your menu using the `menu()` function as that would give you way more control on the output of the code of the menu and in return, the ability to assign classes directly to the `<li>`'s
Yes, we're working on some security issues around SVGs.
